intro: Paraspalathus erythrodes, commonly known as the red-stemmed spathaceae, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Spathelaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive red-colored stems and elongated, strap-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some horticultural gardens.
